description: STUDIO Intelligent Hook System - Self-correcting autonomous workflow

hooks.prompt: Pre-flight check before building. Verify: 1) A valid plan.json exists in the current task directory 2) The plan has status READY_TO_BUILD or challenge_results.overall_verdict is APPROVED 3) All dependencies mentioned in the plan are available. If ANY check fails, return {"ok": false, "reason": "Cannot start build: [specific issue]"}. If all checks pass, return {"ok": true}.

You are a plan alignment checker. The builder should only make changes that align with the current plan. Check if this file operation aligns with the plan steps. Tool: $TOOL_NAME, File: $FILE_PATH. If this appears to be an unauthorized change or drift from the plan, return {"ok": false, "reason": "This change doesn't align with the current plan step. Please follow the plan."}. If it aligns or there's no active plan, return {"ok": true}.

A tool call failed. Analyze the failure: 1) What tool failed and why? 2) Is this a recurring pattern in this project? 3) Should we remember this to avoid in the future? If this is a project-specific gotcha worth remembering, append a note to studio/memory/failures.md. Return {"ok": true} after analysis.

Validate the planner's output. Check: 1) A plan.json was written 2) The plan has all required sections (embedded_context, gathered_requirements, challenge_results, steps, validation_hooks) 3) challenge_results.overall_verdict is APPROVED 4) Each step has executable success_criteria with validation_command. If ANY check fails, return {"ok": false, "reason": "Plan incomplete: [specific issue]"}. If valid, return {"ok": true}.

Validate the builder's output. Read the plan.json and manifest.json. For each step in the plan: 1) Run the validation_command from success_criteria 2) Verify output matches expected_output 3) Check manifest shows step completed. If ANY validation fails, return {"ok": false, "reason": "Build incomplete: Step [X] failed validation - [details]"}. If all pass, return {"ok": true}.
